SENT.plain: It is currently unknown whether immunosuppressive therapy or hematopoietic stem cell transplantation is the most appropriate treatment strategy for children with refractory cytopenia and normal karyotype or trisomy 8
We report on 31 children with hypoplastic refractory cytopenia treated with immunosuppressive therapy consisting of antithymocyte globulin and cyclosporine
At 6 months, 22 of 29 evaluable patients had a complete or partial response; a total of ten patients achieved a complete response at varying time points
Six patients subsequently received a transplant because of non-response, progression to advanced myelodysplastic syndrome or evolution of monosomy 7
Overall and failure-free survival rates at 3 years were 88% and 57%, respectively
